title: A Pro-Family Handbook for Texas (Shaping Policy, Renewing Culture)
year: Patrick T. Brown (Ethics and Public Policy Center)
geographic_scope: State policy; family formation; marriage; fertility; education; youth well-being; tech-in-schools
methodology: Policy priorities framed with polling + social-science claims (success sequence, marriage/fertility trends); state-level recommendations; written for policymakers & aligned stakeholders
core_mechanisms: Sensitivity: 'Pro-Family' framing can read ideological; references to abortion/fetal development + partisan identifiers in polling write-up need careful quoting in donor/board contexts

title: What’s the Plan? Cohabitation, Engagement, and Divorce
year: Scott M. Stanley; Galena K. Rhoades
geographic_scope: Cohabitation; engagement timing; divorce risk; relationship formation; 'sliding vs deciding'
methodology: Quantitative analysis using a national sample of first marriages (2010–2019), outcomes measured as of 2022; practical guidance section; aimed at educated lay + practitioners
core_mechanisms: Sensitivity: strong claims about cohabitation 'effect' and advice tone can be read as moralizing if excerpted; best to foreground methods/limitations and avoid culture-war packaging

title: Making Smartphones and App Stores Safe for Kids: Federal, State, and Industry Measures
geographic_scope: Child online safety; device regulation; app stores; age verification; platform accountability
methodology: Legal/policy landscape review + legislative/industry recommendations; written for lawmakers, regulators, advocates, and parents
core_mechanisms: Sensitivity: references pornography/social media harms + 'Big Tech incentives' language can read partisan; keep scholarly register when summarizing; distinguish what they recommend vs what evidence shows

title: Teens and Tech: What Difference Does Family Structure Make?
year: Jean Twenge; Wendy Wang; Jenet Erickson; Brad Wilcox
geographic_scope: Family structure; teen mental health; screen time; parenting rules; social media policy
methodology: Survey-based analysis + appendix methods; connects family structure to tech use + teen outcomes; audience: policy/public + researchers
core_mechanisms: Sensitivity: family-structure comparisons can be read as stigmatizing single-parent households if not carefully framed; use their precise language + emphasize resources/support not blame

title: Marriage Still Matters: Demonstrating the Link Between Marriage and Fertility in the 21st Century
geographic_scope: Marriage; fertility; nonmarital births; cross-national comparisons; East Asia; OECD
methodology: Multi-method empirical approach: U.S. cohort patterns + OECD correlations + country-level fertility analysis; policy implications section; audience: policy + demography interested readers
core_mechanisms: Sensitivity: conclusion 'marriage still matters' can be heard as prescriptive; careful to separate descriptive findings from normative interpretations when used in interviews/donor language
